3.title: Milestone 3: Precipitation Code Literature Validation
3.description: Comprehensive literature validation of MATLAB precipitation code against published references, focusing on Fang et al. (2010) model, atmospheric physics, and magnetic dipole mechanics

0.title: Phase 3.0: Literature Foundation and References
0.description: Collect and catalog primary literature references for model validation

0.title: Collect and catalog primary literature references
0.description: Collect Fang et al. (2010) paper equations, MSIS 2.0/2.1 documentation, dipole bounce period references, and particle loss cone theory references

1.title: Phase 3.1: Fang 2010 Model Core Validation
1.description: Validate core calculations from Fang et al. (2010) paper: energy dissipation parameterization and ionization rate

0.title: Validate energy dissipation parameterization (calc_Edissipation.m)
0.description: Validate Fang 2010 equation y = (2/E)(ρ·H)^0.7(6×10⁻⁶)^(-0.7), coefficient exp() usage, and f(z,E) formula for 100 eV - 1 MeV range

1.title: Validate ionization rate calculation (calc_ionization.m)
1.description: Validate constant 0.035, q_tot formula Qe/0.035 × f/H, integration direction, and cumulative sum logic

2.title: Phase 3.2: Bounce and Mirror Mechanics Validation
2.description: Validate magnetic dipole bounce period and mirror altitude calculations

0.title: Validate bounce period equation (bounce_time_arr.m)
0.description: Validate relativistic formula constants (mc2 values), L-shell dependency, dipole field assumptions, and numerical vs analytical solution

1.title: Validate mirror altitude calculation (dipole_mirror_altitude.m)
1.description: Validate magnetic field ratio B_ratio formula, r = L·R_E·cos²(λ) relationship, and interpolation method accuracy

3.title: Phase 3.3: Atmospheric Data and MSIS Integration
3.description: Validate MSIS atmospheric data retrieval and integration with precipitation model

0.title: Validate MSIS data retrieval (get_msis_dat.m)
0.description: Validate F107 and Ap index usage vs MSIS documentation, altitude range validity (0-1000 km), and mass density/scale height units

4.title: Phase 3.4: Unit Consistency and Constants
4.description: Validate physical constants, unit conversions, and coordinate system definitions

0.title: Validate physical constants and unit conversions
0.description: Validate Earth radius (6371 km), bounce time constants (0.511 MeV e⁻, 938 MeV p⁺), energy unit conversions (keV vs MeV), and 6×10⁻⁶ density constant

1.title: Validate coordinate systems and angular definitions
1.description: Validate equatorial pitch angle definition (0-90° vs 90-180° handling), L-shell definition (Earth radii), and mirror latitude relationship

5.title: Phase 3.5: Integration Logic and Edge Cases
5.description: Validate precipitation loss calculation, numerical methods, and edge case handling

0.title: Validate precipitation loss calculation (fang10_precip.m)
0.description: Validate loss factor q_to_mirror/q_top, time evolution dQe/dt = 2·Qe_loss/t_b, boundary conditions (mirror altitude > 1000km, < 0km, NaN), and energy range enforcement

1.title: Validate numerical methods and stability
1.description: Validate trapezoidal integration for q_cum, interpolation accuracy for mirror altitude lookup, time stepping stability (dt handling), and negative value enforcement

6.title: Phase 3.6: Cross-Component Validation
6.description: Validate consistency across energy/flux calculations and atmospheric boundary integration

0.title: Validate energy and flux consistency
0.description: Validate incident energy flux Qe = j·E (units and sign), energy dissipation f(z,E) vs ionization q_tot connection, and cumulative vs local ionization rate definitions

1.title: Validate atmospheric boundary integration
1.description: Validate integration from top of atmosphere downward, mirror altitude as lower integration bound, and physical interpretation of cumulative ionization
